Beyond doubt, a lack of effective vaccination, antiviral agent, and treatment strategies are a public health emergency. Ribavirin tried in Kerala outbreak in 2018 was not able to show statistical benefit.
5 Although there are some promising results from antiviral drugs such as Remsdesivir
6 in the non-human trial against Nipah virus, it is yet early to speculate its efficacy and safety in humans. It is pertinent that we prepare ourselves at this moment by consolidating public health awareness, mobilizing stakeholders, and strengthening multidisciplinary collaboration. Above all, if we are to win this race, we need to respect ‘one health’
7 and honor the intricate relationship between humans, animals, and the surrounding environment.
